name: Buzzard's Bay Bourbon Scallops
author: Doug Matthews
summary: This dish was conceptualized for the Victory Dinner Celebration at the 2014 Buzzard's Bay Cup Challenge. It played off local and imported ingredients for the event. I like to serve these over a field of wilted greens like Swiss or rainbow chard.
ingredients: 2 pounds sea scallops, rinsed and patted dry
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Melt 1/4 cup butter, 2 ounces bourbon, and olive oil together in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook sea scallops in hot butter-bourbon mixture until browned and just about cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side
Transfer scallops to a plate and drain any excess liquid from the skillet

Whisk remaining butter, remaining bourbon, brown sugar, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper together in the same skillet over medium-high heat until sauce reduces and alcohol evaporates, 1 to 3 minutes
